oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Muster roll of Co. A, 2nd Tenn. Cav. Regt. USA at Cumberland Gap
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Muster roll of Capts. John H. Byrd and Solomon Irick's Co. A of Campbell County Unionists mustered in at Jacksboro and sent early in the war to the Cumberland Gap to defend that vital transportation gateway. Though the record is dated for the regiment's original enlistment in Aug. 1862, it appears to reflect the company's re-enlistment in Murfreesboro in Jan. 1863 following the Battle of Stones River. There the regiment was engaged and suffered casualties.
